December 2nd, 1941.
DOPE ON NSW YORK FM STATIONS
Novik, WNYC, speaking:
Mr. Prank E. SchooJ
Executive Secrej^alTy,
National Association of Educational Broadcasters,
Station
TJrbanalinois.
sar Schooley:
' 4he dismissal of the petition for re¬
hearing and other relief directed against us by
Station WDRC in Hartford was to get us to change
the original grant by the P. C. C. of 43.5 Mega¬
cycles to 43.9 Megacycles. The P. C. C. then issued
us a modified construction permit to permit us to
erect a new PM station, W39NY, here in New York in
the commercial band.
ii
In the non-commercial band, WNYE is
now in the process of constructing their new FM
station, which will be completed some time during
January, 1942, whereas ours will be completed some
time during March of 1942.^
Cordially,
VaXjl^ -
